33079831 Proof of Life ['inkinmyheartandonthepage'] General Audiences Gen Marvel Cinematic Universe, The Avengers (Marvel Movies) Peter Parker & Tony Stark Peter Parker, Tony Stark, Stephen Strange, Cloak of Levitation - Character, Bruce Banner, Steve Rogers, Natasha Romanov (Marvel), Sam Wilson (Marvel), Clint Barton, James "Rhodey" Rhodes Tony Stark Acting as Peter Parker's Parental Figure, Peter Parker is Tony Stark's Biological Child, Kid Peter Parker, Peter Parker Needs a Hug, Precious Peter Parker, Cute Peter Parker, Adorable Peter Parker, Tony Stark Has a Heart, Tony Stark Needs a Hug, Tony Stark & Stephen Strange Friendship, Forgetful Tony Stark, Domestic Avengers, Avengers Family, Nobody believes Tony Stark, Cute, Fluff, Tooth-Rotting Fluff, Banter, Tony Stark & Stephen Strange banter, Tony Stark Does What He Wants, Parent Tony Stark, Steve Rogers Has Issues, Civil War Fix-It, civil war never happened, Protective Stephen Strange, Cloak of Levitation (Marvel), Cloak of Levitation loves Peter, Everybody loves Peter Parker English 2021-08-07 Completed 2021-08-07 1,508 1/1 125 10,235 726 94,461 ['Veroorodriguezzz', 'Hadenas', 'gooses_trenchcoat', 'Krys0613', 'Book_Nerd_2009', 'bebo_bay', 'fallingupwards123', 'Lydiazamora09', 'gamingvillz', 'Calliopeiry', 'Irondad_spiderson4ever', 'Lily_Of_The_Valley07', 'pon_dlee', 'lola_bunny15', 'ANQRRR', 'MerakiGigil', '24_WhoAmI_A5', 'kamyle2thestars', 'Minnie_Reader', 'areijnia', 'bookeatingworm', 'Caddy1951', 'lastnailonthenerdsign', 'Lulovesremmy', 'Aunteakit', 'Confusion_mississippi', 'KingMonchichi', 'Happy_Dreams', 'SomethingWithoutAnything', '18Gin_san_Yorozuya27', 'RobinQuinton', 'Rolorowley', 'Luca_4711_Luca', 'SleepyAri', 'Chichi_Saphis1412', 'Bliskd', 'HolographicWindow', 'perksofbeingawallflower', '23RatsInACardigan', 'ThatHumanLol', 'BlackSmith2020', 'stinkmaster', 'meepmeepmine', 'Renga_Simp', 'Yay49', 'Chocchip12354', 'zanes_astral_void', 'me_moo', 'qvestria', 'Rainbow7e'] []  

 

"Ah, Bruce," Steve greeted as the scientist wondered into the Avenger's communal living room. "There you are."

 

"Sorry I'm late," Bruce gave the waiting group an apologetic smile. "I had to finish up my experiment. Sorry to keep you all waiting."

 

"It's fine," Natasha smiled at the scientist. "We are waiting on Tony anyway."

 

"Oh, Tony is already out," Bruce said, wiping his glasses on his shirt. He slid them onto his face and blinked at the group. "He said he would he meet us at the Sanctum."

 

Doctor Stephen Strange, Master of the Mystic Arts had summoned (and Steve was under the impression it was not an invitation and more of a demand) them to the Sanctum to go over some potential threats he had come across. Steve was still a little confused as to what exactly the man does and how exactly he does it. Steve wasn't, however, about to turn up the opportunity to get ahead on some potential threats, no matter where the source came from.

 

"Did he say why he was going to be late?" Steve frowned, irritation licking under his skin. Tony had a particular habit of being continually called away when it came to meetings.

 

"He had to pick up Peter," Bruce said.

 

Steve sighed, shaking his head. For as long as Steve had known Tony Stark, the man had claimed that he had a son named Peter. The self-proclaimed genius, billionaire, playboy, philanthropist reputation was many things, but being father was not one of them. At first Steve hadn't believed Tony when he had first mentioned Peter. In fact, the whole team had had a laugh at the ridiculous notion. Apart from Rhodey's who simply shook his head at them and mumbled something snarky under his breath. Tony had rolled his eyes and said that he would introduce Peter to them when he could. The billionaire never did though, always claiming he had forgotten whenever the asked him about it.

 

"Peter again," Steve sighed, his shoulder's sagging. "How long is he going to use his imaginary child as an excuse?"

 

"Steve," Bruce warned, his look disapproving. "Tony wouldn't lie about a child."

 

"Yeah, that's outlandish for even him," Sam agreed, crossing his arms over his chest.

 

"I haven't seen any proof," Clint shrugged. "Maybe the man took one too many hits in that tin can of his."

 

"Peter is real," Rhodey said firmly. "And Tony will introduce him to you when he's ready."

 

"Rhodey's right," Natasha said. "Besides, we're going to be even later if we don't leave now."

 

Steve wanted to ask Rhodey more about Peter and why Tony was 'forgetting' to introduce them to Peter, but Natasha was right and Steve hated being late. "Alright. Everyone to the cars."

 

As they drove towards the New York Sanctum, Steve couldn't stop thinking about Tony and his claims that he had a child. Tony was always busy, whether it was Stark Industry work, Iron Man, or saving the world with the Avengers, the man never sat still. In all the conversation between Tony and Steve, the billionaire had never given Steve any indication that he liked children. Of course, Tony would sign their papers and pose for a photo with the children that stopped him on the street, but he always had that paparazzi smile on his face.

 

Tony had never mentioned a mother, which didn't help in his argument that he had a child. Tony didn't bring Peter up often, only when he was late to a meeting. He used the excuse that Peter had needed him or that he had to go pick up Peter from school.

 

By the time they pulled up to the Sanctum, Steve had decided that he needed to have a word with Tony about his imaginary son. It was not good for the man's mental health and Steve was tired of him using Peter as an excuse to get out of meetings.

 

Rhodey knocked on the door to the Sanctum and the door opened with a steady creak but there was no one on the other side. Sharing a glance with one another, the carefully stepped inside. There were voice's just beyond the entrance and Steve took the lead and followed them in.

 

As he stepped into a large entrance hall, a beautiful staircase leading to rooms unknown, his jaw threatened to drop as he took in the scene before him.

 

Tony lounged on the stairs casually. Anyone would think he was relaxed as anything, but Steve could see the sharp glint in his eyes as he eyes tracked movement above him. Beside him, Doctor Stephen Strange sat a little straighter, a small smile tugging on his lips. Both of their attention was on what looked to be a red magic carpet.

 

The red cloth swooped and dived above them, bright laughter, and giggling erupting around the Sanctum as a young boy sat on top, clutching the fabric tightly in his hands. The boy let out a whoop at the sudden dive, bringing them to eye level.

 

"Dad look!" the boy cried with delight. "I'm flying!"

 

"You sure are Underoos," Tony agreed, smiling brightly. Steve saw him turn to Strange. "If that cape drops him, I'll blast you."

 

"It's the Cloak of Levitation," Stephen glared lightly at Tony. "It is a relic of the mystic arts and has a will of its own."

 

"What's it's feeling towards eight-year-olds?" Tony asked.

 

"Far more generous than my feelings towards you," Stephen drawled with a smirk.

 

Tony opened his mouth to retort but at that moment the red cloth screeched to a halt and wrapped around the boy. Tony and Stephen jumped to their feet, hurrying down the last remaining steps.

 

Steve realised very quickly that it wasn't a carpet but rather a cloak. It was far too big for the boy, but it gently lowered him to the ground. It pooled around the boys' legs; the cloak far too big for him. The boy didn't seem to care though as he stared slack jawed at the Avengers.

 

"Dad look! It's the Avenger's," the boy gaped at the group.

 

"Sure is," Tony said, coming to a stop behind the boy, threading his fingers into the boys' curls and gently massaging. "You guys finally made it. And you always harp on me for being late."

 

"Who this?" Steve asked, pointing to the little boy.

 

Tony smirked. "Oh, this is my son. Peter. Say hi Underoos."

 

"Hi Captain America sir!" Peter beamed, waving grandly.

 

"Hello," Steve parroted back, feeling as if he had just missed a step.

 

Tony's son was real. Tony hadn't been lying. Steve had been so sure that Tony had made up a son but here he was, in the flesh. Guilt stabbed at Steve. He should have believed Tony and the shuffling behind him made him think that a few other members were feeling the same guilt.

 

"Now that you are all here, we may begin," Stephen said in a deep voice that seemed to rumble through the Sanctum. "We have much to discuss."

 

"Alright Underoos, give the wizard back his cape," Tony said.

 

"It's Sorcerer Supreme," Stephen muttered as Peter let out a long drawn 'awwwww'.

 

The cloak's collar dropped, wrapping more firmly around the boy, making Steve start. How did it do that? Steve blinked as Stephen narrowed his eyes at Peter.

 

"My shoulders, now," Stephen commanded.

 

The cloak's collar shook and gently patted Peter's cheeks, causing the boy to giggle.

 

Stephen rolled his eyes and let out a deep sigh. "Fine, stay with the boy. You can keep an eye on him."

 

"Yay! Thanks Mr. Wizard," Peter beamed, darting to hug Stephen around the knees before drawing back and taking Tony's hand.

 

"Enjoy it while it lasts, Underoos," Tony warned. "The cape isn't coming home with us."

 

"Cloak of Levitation," Stephen corrected with a glare.

 

Tony grinned. "Sure, whatever you say, Wizard."

 

Stephen rolled his eyes and turned on his heel. He started up the stairs, Tony chuckling as he tugged Peter up the stairs after the taller man.

 

Steve was knocked out of his staring when Rhodey brushed passed him, following Tony and Stephen up the stairs. Steve mentally shook his head and followed along with the rest of the Avengers. When they were done, Steve made a mental note to apologise to Tony. He should have believed them that he had a son.

 

"Dad," Peter whispered loudly in a way that children did. "Can you ask the Wizard if he could make me a cloak?"

 

Steve grinned as he watched Tony shake his vehemently. "No way. Sorry Underoos. You're not allowed to go flying around until you're at least fifty."

 

"How about I teach you ancient mystic arts instead," Stephen said, smirking at Tony.

 

Tony growled. "Don't you dare."

 

"Dad please!" Peter begged, tugging on Tony's hand.

 

Steve chuckled as Tony shot Stephen a furious glare. "I'm going to kill you."

 

Yes, Steve owed Tony a big apology. Fatherhood suited him and Steve was happy to be proven wrong.

 

 

 

 
25018996 A Lot's Gonna Change ['etymologyplayground'] Teen And Up Audiences M/M Mo Dao Zu Shi - Mo Xiang Tong Chou | Modao Zushi - Moxiang Tongxiu, Chen Qing Ling | The Untamed (TV) Lan Zhan | Lan Wangji/Wei Ying | Wei Wuxian, Wei Ying | Wei Wuxian & Wen Qing, Luo "Mian Mian" Qingyang & Wei Ying | Wei Wuxian Wei Ying | Wei Wuxian, Lan Zhan | Lan Wangji, Wen Qing, Luo "Mian Mian" Qingyang Meet-Cute, Weddings, Humor, Banter, Flirting, Slow Dancing, One Shot, Alternate Universe - Modern Setting, Sexual Tension English 2020-07-01 Completed 2020-07-01 5,752 1/1 435 10,176 2,071 52,762 ['LunarLove14', 'Im_reading_here', 'Ruiinee', 'nevertheless_turtle', 'chocolateandmurder', 'PandoraParrot', 'LotusPods', 'Icantchoose', 'Spekter', 'fuwafuwa_cake', 'BTS_MiCasa', 'Chaos_creates', 'Ela_282', 'CruccoBritannico', 'lemurch', 'hitome_bore', 'itsbreeee41', 'BlanketBoiProtectionSquad', 'ThatRandoInTheCorner', 'froggermini', 'printx', 'Mizukiri', 'dontheckinswear', 'karakael', 'queenhy', 'thatfatpigeon', 'matsinko', 'mybly', 'ThatWillowTree', '3Eldritch_Goose', 'Yumemik', 'Aashi213', 'Kalenmarc', 'wiseterria', 'raxtar', 'emerald_6', 'squishyshinki', 'beijiguang', 'apelsin240', 'TheLastSaskPirate', 'ruminativedawn', 'liasakuraaa', 'Maxia22', 'Akshi', 'katerwaul', 'adiosperse', 'Lisztomany', 'local_gay_vodca_parent', 'NeonEtiquette', 'liimsy'] []
Wei Ying leans back against the bar, peering out at the suits, the dresses. The glitter of watches that cost more than his college tuition, made visible as shoulders are clapped, toasts made. Glossy hair cut and styled in London or Singapore just hours before the wedding and then flown carefully across countries, oceans, to catch the light here, at stupid Wen Chao's insufferable wedding. It's the marital equivalent of a Cheesecake Factory: an inexplicable combination of vulgar expense and utter cheapassery. Red silk shot through with real gold thread drapes artfully over plastic folding tables. There are goodie bags for guests which include earring-sized Tiffany-blue boxes and also fun-size Snickers bars. Wei Ying is being paid twenty bucks an hour to pour sparkling white wine from their absolute lowest price tier into cut-crystal glasses from the 1920s.


 


"Mianmian," he says thoughtfully, as he watches Wen Chao suck face with Wang Lingjiao across the room. "How long do you give this marriage? A year?"


 


"Save your gossip for after we get paid," Luo Mian advises him. She's polishing glasses again, which she does when her options are Polish Glasses or Lose Her Mind. "Also, I'd give them two kids and a teeny dog before they split up."


 


"Hmmm," Wei Ying says. "That's awfully optimistic."






"He has too much pride to split earlier," she points out, "and she has too little spine. Incoming."


 


Wei Ying grunts and pushes off the bar to go bartend. Tend bar. Whatever. "What can I get for you?" he asks the suit-and-dress that just walked up, and then he flicks his eyes up to their faces and exclaims, "Wen Qing! What in the hell are you doing here?" And then he remembers that, of course, Wen Qing is distantly related to Wen Chao.


 


"Suffering," Wen Qing says darkly.


 


"Great," Wei Ying says. "Us too. You want a drink?"


 


"As a woman of medicine," Wen Qing begins, "I am familiar with the detrimental effects of excessive alcohol consumption, so I would like to request one glass of champagne."


 


"First of all, it's not champagne," Wei Ying says. "It's sparkling white wine that was seven dollars at Costco. Second of all, I'm sensing a 'but.'"


 


"But," Wen Qing agrees. "As Wen Chao's only young, pretty female relative, I'm in Wang Lingjiao's bridal party and it has taken all of my strength not to poison everyone involved in this farce of a wedding." Luo Mian snorts. "Give me whatever's strong and expensive. It's an open bar, right? Give me their money's worth."


 


"Do we count as involved?" Wei Ying asks, reaching for the nice rum. Nicer rum. The rum that cost more than a dollar an ounce. It still isn't very good. "How do you feel about daiquiris?"


 


"I feel extremely positively about daiquiris. You don't count as involved, you're getting paid to be here," Wen Qing allows. "All the guests, I mean. A-Ning is so lucky he was busy this weekend."


 


Wen Ning is lucky for a lot of reasons, not the least of which being that he plays video games professionally and has recently started making more money at it than Wei Ying makes bartending. He's playing some tournament right now. "Wen Ning ah," Wei Ying sighs, squeezing a lime forlornly into the shaker. "Never forget who first taught you how to do a combo in Smash."


 


"Yes, he owes it all to you," Wen Qing agrees, one eyebrow arched sardonically.


 


"Pshaw," Wei Ying says, uncomfortably aware that Wen Ning does, in fact, believe he owes it all to Wei Ying, because it was Wei Ying's idea for him to get serious about gaming after they were both thrown out of university. Wei Ying thinks that any gaming-related debt should be cancelled out by the fact that it was his fault they got thrown out at all. "Hey, Wen Qing, meet Mianmian, she's cool," he says, and starts shaking the daiquiri shaker loudly. He continues shaking as they introduce themselves, and Wen Qing gestures to her companion and introduces him too, although Wei Ying misses his name because of the ice rattling around in his hands. He's very handsome, which is why Wei Ying has not addressed him yet. He gets annoying when he meets new people, Wei Ying knows, and he gets especially annoying when he meets hot people, and he is trying to make tips here.


 


When the daiquiri is mixed, he pours it through a strainer into one of the ridiculous fancy glasses, throws a candied lime peel on, and slides it over to Wen Qing, who takes it and drinks half of it in one go.


 


"Good heavens," Wei Ying says.


 


"You're not driving, are you?" Luo Mian checks.


 


Wen Qing swallows and says, "No, Lan Zhan is driving for the night," indicating her companion.


 


"You want any juice?" Wei Ying offers to him. "Soda?"


 


Lan Zhan looks at him. His eyes are such a light shade of brown as to be almost amber. "No, thank you," he says. "Just ice water, if you please."


 


Wei Ying raises his eyebrows. So polite! "One artisanal ice water, coming right up," he says. "Just kidding. It's tap water. You want a lemon? A lime?"


 


"No, thank you," Lan Zhan repeats.


 


"Ah, so boring!" Wei Ying cries, but he gives Lan Zhan his water in a fancy glass anyway. "So, Wen-jiejie, who's this dreadful young man you've brought to meet me, huh? Where did you find him? A library?"


 


"Yes," Wen Qing says, and doesn't elaborate.


 


"Are you each other's beards?" Wei Ying guesses, mostly joking.


 


Lan Zhan says, "I don't know what that means."


 


Wen Qing says, "Yes." Then, to Lan Zhan, she says, "It's what we're doing."


 


"Hn," Lan Zhan says, with a cautious look at Wei Ying and then Luo Mian.


 


"Dude, don't worry, we're cool," Wei Ying says quickly. "Wen Qing and I have bearded for each other too. Hey, maybe we should be bitter exes," he adds to Wen Qing. "Wow. Wen Qing. I can't believe you've brought your new boyfriend. I'm devastated."


 


"I am equally hurt that you've brought your new girlfriend," Wen Qing says. "I feel replaced."


 


"Leave me out of this," Luo Mian says with a grimace. "I didn't cut all ties with my family just to pretend to date a man."


 


"You date men," Wei Ying points out. "You're dating a man right now."


 


"Yeah, but not

you,"

Luo Mian says.


 


"Ouch."


 


"It's nothing personal. Your role in my life is to validate me when I whine," Luo Mian says. "It's a very important role and you perform it excellently."


 


"Thank you," Wei Ying says, touched.


 


"Interestingly, that's

my

role in

his

life," Wen Qing observes.


 


"Yeah, except you do less validating and more telling me to start taking better notes," Wei Ying says. To be fair, taking better notes would solve a lot of the problems that he whines about to Wen Qing. "Hey, if Wen Qing whines to Mianmian, we'll have a nice little ecosystem."


 


"No, no, I complain to Lan Zhan," Wen Qing says. Lan Zhan makes a little sound of agreement. Across the room Wen Chao and Wang Lingjiao have started making out. There's a lot of visible tongue.


 


"Alright, well, Lan Zhan can complain to Mianmian," Wei Ying decides.


 


"Lan Zhan doesn't complain about anything," Wen Qing dismisses him. "He keeps all his irritation right here --" She gestures at Lan Zhan's chest. "-- and then someday, he'll die."


 


"If nothing is to be done about the problem, it's useless to complain," Lan Zhan says, his eyes on his glass of water.


 


"Right, obviously, but there's a difference between complaining about stuff that matters, which sucks, and stuff that doesn't matter, which rocks," Wei Ying tells him. "Complaining about being forced to perform heterosexuality for your parents and their peers sucks, but complaining about this asinine wedding rocks."


 


"Hm," Lan Zhan says.


 


Wei Ying gives him his very best Applying Peer Pressure expression. "Do it, Lan Zhan. Say this wedding is tacky and awful and they're both terrible people. You're friends with Wen Qing, I know you're thinking it. Here, here, you don't even need to say it aloud, you can just wink if I'm right."


 


Lan Zhan looks at him with a blank expression. He's not a very expressive person, apparently. Wei Ying holds his gaze and decides that he wants to make him crack.


 


Then he jumps about a foot in the air as someone crashes into the bar and slurs, "Give me -- oh, fuck, what's she drinking? Give me one of those." It's Wang Lingjiao, who has somehow separated herself from her new husband and wobbled her way over to sprawl across the bar. They've already given her four glasses of wine, one for each time Wen Chao publicly groped someone other than her.


 


And... She's insufferable, but no one deserves Wen Chao. Maybe he can find it in his heart to feel, perhaps, a crumb of sympathy for her. "Long day, huh," Wei Ying says.


 


"Am I paying you to chat, or to give me drinks?" she says. Ah, there goes the crumb.


 


"Right," Wei Ying says, and reaches for the rum again. The cheap rum this time. Cheaper. The four of them are silent as he makes the daiquiri. Wang Lingjiao slumps on her stool, blowing air through her lips occasionally. If she were his friend, he would make her drink some water before giving her any more alcohol; she'll have a killer hangover tomorrow either way, but water would mitigate it.


 


She is not his friend. He gives her the daiquiri.


 


"Took you long enough," she says, grabbing the drink, and stumbles away.





Wei Ying sucks on his teeth in disgust. Luo Mian mutters, "Bitch."


 


Wen Qing curls her lip and says, "She'll have a horrible morning."


 


Lan Zhan just meets Wei Ying's gaze. One of his finely shaped eyebrows twitches, minuscule and damning. His expression is completely blank when he winks, serious and deliberate, at Wei Ying.


 


Shocked laughter bubbles up Wei Ying's throat and out of his mouth, fizzes along his shoulders and out through his fingertips. He can feel his ears turning red with the pleasure of being winked at, even under such circumstances and with such an expression, by a beautiful man.


 


"What are you laughing at?" Luo Mian wonders.


 


"Nothing! Nothing." Wei Ying makes grabby hands at the polishing cloth. "Give me that, it's my turn to polish some glasses."


 


"Uh huh," Luo Mian says, sounding like she knows exactly why he wants to keep his hands busy. But she hands over the cloth and lets him polish, so she's forgiven for perceiving him. "How do you two know each other?" she asks, and at first he thinks she means Wen Qing and Lan Zhan, which he's also curious about, but then she adds, "My condolences, by the way," which means she's asking Wen Qing about

him.



 


"We went to the same high school," Wen Qing says. "He was nice to my brother so he's the only person I still talk to. Also we were lab partners for a semester and Wei Ying let me do all the dissections."


 


Wei Ying grimaces. The previous semester he had been paired with some jerk whose name he doesn't even remember anymore who made Wei Ying do all the dissecting because it was gross, and then refused to help write the report about it because, of course, he didn't do any of the dissection. Then the guy got busted for trying to take the lens from the cow eyeball home in his pocket.


 


Wei Ying was more than happy to let Wen Qing do all the dissections after that, and she was happy to let him write the reports. By the end of the semester they had the highest grades in the class. Then Wen Qing graduated and went to university, and then the year after that Wei Ying graduated and went to university, and then the year after

that

 he and Wen Ning both got thrown out.


 


Wei Ying clears his throat, then turns it into a scoff. "Hey, I'm still nice to your brother."


 


Wen Qing leans across the bar to pat his head. "Yeah, you are. Good boy. I know where you live. How do you know each other?" she asks Luo Mian.


 


"College," Luo Mian says. She hadn't been kicked out, but her family had pulled all their financial support and she'd had to drop out and finish her degree at a community college.


 


"We almost dated," Wei Ying chirps.


 


"We did not almost date," Luo Mian says. "You flirted with me one time and then I was mean to you about it forever."


 


"Uh, yeah," Wei Ying says, "I love when people are mean to me."


 


Luo Mian rolls her eyes. "You want another daiquiri?" she offers to Wen Qing.


 


"Please," Wen Qing says with feeling, handing her empty glass over. "Less sugar, more rum this time, please."


 


"You got it."


 


"A-Qing? Is that you over there?"


 


Wen Qing straightens and turns, a real smile blooming over her face. "Popo ah! Where have you been all evening, I thought you must have gone home," she says in Mandarin to the approaching Madam Wen, who is approximately ten thousand years old and one of Wei Ying's favorite people on the fucking planet.


 


"I've been hiding in the ladies' room," Madam Wen admits in her creaky old lady voice. Wen Qing takes her hand and tugs her close. "What a shame, my little nephew, what a shame. What sort of wedding! Is that little Wei Ying back here? A-Ying, come here and let Popo see you."


 


Wei Ying grins and leans across the bar so that Madam Wen can cup his face in her hands, which are soft and wrinkly and smell of soap and powder. He lets her squish his cheeks and inspect his eyes and tongue, just in case. "First Wen Qing and now Popo is here," he remarks cheerfully when she pats his cheeks in satisfaction. "My day just keeps getting better!"


 


"You're still too skinny," Madam Wen tells him. "When will you marry a nice girl who'll fatten you up? A-Qing, you too, you're too too skinny by far. Who is this handsome young man? Are you A-Qing's boyfriend?" She peers up at Lan Zhan, who is probably a full foot and a half taller than she is.


 


"He sure is," Wen Qing lies through a wide smile. "This is Lan Zhan, Popo. He's in library studies. Are you enjoying the wedding?"


 


Madam Wen scoffs. "The wedding! Hah! What a joke! Neither of those children have spoken to me once. If my brother were still alive he would be ashamed. A-Ying, be a good boy and make your Popo a hot water."


 


"Yes ma'am," Wei Ying says, and puts the kettle on.


 


Madam Wen squints at Lan Zhan. "Young man, do you speak Mandarin?"


 


"I do," Lan Zhan replies. "I grew up in Shanghai."


 


"Shanghai! What are they teaching young people in Shanghai these days? Ice water! Pah! You'll fill up with phlegm!" She pokes his belly, which is approximately the level of her shoulders. "A-Ying, give this boy some hot water, you're poisoning him."


 


Wei Ying meets Lan Zhan's eyes and shrugs cheerfully. "Gotta do what Popo tells me," he says, and pours two steaming bowls of hot water. When he hands the second bowl to Lan Zhan, their fingers brush. "This Wei Ying apologizes for poisoning Wen Qing's dashing young man."


 


Lan Zhan hums. He maintains eye contact as he tips the water into his mouth. Wen Qing says in English, "Oh my god."


 


Wei Ying has no idea what she's talking about.







*







Madam Wen dodders away eventually, possibly back to the ladies' room to avoid having to congratulate her utter disappointment of a great-nephew on his wedding, but Wen Qing and Lan Zhan continue to loiter around the bar for the rest of the evening. Wei Ying is absolutely fucking delighted to realize that actually Wen Chao seems to be a little afraid of Lan Zhan or Wen Qing or both, a fact which becomes clear when Wei Ying and Luo Mian watch him tip his empty glass upside-down into his mouth, slide a longing glance over to the bar, and then turn hastily away on four separate occasions.


 


"Wow," Wei Ying says the fourth time it happens. "This is great, actually. This wedding rocks. Which one of you is he afraid of, do you think?"


 


"Probably both of us," Wen Qing says, "but especially Lan Zhan. He knows I can't kick his ass in the presence of my family."


 


Wei Ying raises his eyebrows. "And Lan Zhan can?"


 


"I would not," Lan Zhan says, which is a bummer. But then, after a slight pause, he adds, "He doesn't need to know that."


 


"Lan Zhan, you sly fox," Wei Ying says admiringly. "What on earth have you done to him?"


 


"He is quick to anger, quick to fight, and quick to lose," Lan Zhan says, which is code for,

I beat his ass.

 "He's decided it is easier to pretend that I am particularly intimidating than to acknowledge that he is particularly pathetic."


 


"He's being humble," Wen Qing tells Wei Ying. "Lan Zhan teaches Chen tai chi. He knows how to throw a punch."


 


"Cool," Wei Ying says, looking at the ceiling and thinking about biceps. "Great. Awesome. I love that for you, Lan Zhan."


 


"It's traditional," Lan Zhan says, "and I wouldn't fight for no reason," as if he maybe thinks it was disapproval that caught in Wei Ying's throat instead of pure gay energy.


 


"Believe me, I trust you had reason," Wei Ying reassures him. "He went to our high school too."


 


"Hm," Lan Zhan says, his eyes narrowed in a delicate grimace. "My condolences." Wei Ying snorts, delighted.


 


"Remember how I told you about the kid who punched Wen Chao on behalf of A-Ning?" Wen Qing says to Lan Zhan. "That was Wei Ying."


 


"I broke my thumb," Wei Ying says mournfully. Then, less mournfully, "And his nose. Now I can write with my left hand too and he's got ten thousand dollars of plastic in his face."


 


"How are either of you even here??" Luo Mian wonders.


 


"I'm not sure Wen Chao remembers who exactly I am," Wei Ying admits. "Since apparently getting punched out by hot people is a frequent occurrence for him."


 


"The wedding invitation said I could bring a plus-one and no one ever asked who I was going to bring," Wen Qing says. "I was prepared to lie if they did, though."


 


"I like it," Luo Mian says.


 


"Would you like to learn how to throw a punch without breaking your thumb?" Lan Zhan asks.


 


Wei Ying learned how to throw a proper punch shortly after the thumb break incident, and has punched more than one person since then without disaster. He's dabbled in bagua zhang and a couple different schools of kung fu and even American kickboxing. He knows how to throw a punch.


 


"Please," he says, offering his hand across the bar. He can see Luo Mian and Wen Qing rolling their eyes at each other out of the corner of his eye, but Lan Zhan is a good sport, so he takes Wei Ying's hand and curls it into a fist.


 


"Your thumb goes outside your fingers," Lan Zhan tells him seriously. He holds Wei Ying's fist in his hand and brushes his fingers along the back of it. "Align your hand and forearm so that the line from your knuckles to your elbow is straight. Like this the force from the punch travels up your arm." He gestures with his hand up Wei Ying's forearm, all the way up to the crumple of his rolled-up sleeve at his elbow.


 


Wei Ying's mouth is pretty dry just about now.


 


"You need to start with correct posture," Lan Zhan continues. "Feet apart. Your body should be at an angle to your opponent." He reaches across the bar and taps two fingers against Wei Ying's left shoulder. "Your right hand is dominant, so your left shoulder faces me."


 


Wei Ying shifts to obey. "You're my opponent now?" he asks.


 


"For the purposes of this exercise," Lan Zhan says, stepping to one side to mirror Wei Ying's posture.


 


"I bet you could teach him even better if you were standing behind him," says Luo Mian, who is a bro.


 


"Oh my god," says Wen Qing, who is not a bro. "Lan Zhan, he's fucking with you, Wei Ying knows how to throw a punch."


 


Lan Zhan looks to him for confirmation, and Wei Ying kind of smiles guiltily and gives Lan Zhan's shoulder a gentle tap with a perfectly-formed fist. "I thought I'd touch up on my skills," he says, instead of

I thought you might hold my hand a little.



 


"I see," Lan Zhan says flatly. His face, which is already not particularly expressive, has gone even more blank than it has been.


 


"Ahh," Wei Ying says, feeling his heart fall. "I wasn't -- I'm not making fun of you," he says. "I was just... playing around. I guess."


 


"Oh man. You want another drink?" Luo Mian asks Wen Qing.


 


"Yes, please. This is painful," Wen Qing says.


 


All at once Wei Ying runs out of patience with himself. "This is

stupid,"

he decides. "Oh my god. I'm really not getting any younger. Lan Zhan, I wasn't making fun of you and I wasn't really playing around either. I was flirting with you. Is that okay?"


 


Lan Zhan blinks. His expression hardly changes at all, but his ears get steadily pinker. "... Yes," he says at last, after waiting just long enough to make Wei Ying start to sweat. "You can flirt with me."


 


"Great," Wei Ying says, feeling suddenly breathless. "Great. I like -- hey, do you want to dance with me?" He gestures at the dance floor, which is notably free of the horrible happy couple and populated mostly by various uncles and aunts instead.


 


Lan Zhan looks at him seriously. Then he nods. Wei Ying blinks. "What, really?"


 


"Mn," Lan Zhan says. "I'll dance with you."


 


Wei Ying laughs nervously. "Even though you're here as Wen Qing's beard?"


 


Lan Zhan casts a thoughtful look around. "I believe those who would care are either drunk or gone for the night."


 


"Go for it, boys," Wen Qing says. "You have my blessing."


 


"We barely even needed two bartenders to begin with," Luo Mian agrees.


 


"Okay, yeah," Wei Ying says. "Um, here's the stupid part. Do you even know how to dance like that? Because I don't." He and Jiang Cheng did both dragon and lion dancing as high schoolers; Wei Ying was the pearl in dragon dancing and the butt end of the lion. He's pretty sure the only friend he has who might really know how to slow dance in the European style is Nie Huaisang, and that's a big

maybe.



 


"I do not," Lan Zhan admits. Then, with a look out at the crowd, he remarks, "It seems to involve mostly swaying in time. I think we can manage that."


 


He's right; most of the people here are just stepping or swaying from side to side, their hands clasped at shoulder height or looped around each other's bodies. There's a live string quartet (!) playing something slow and unfamiliar.


 


Yeah, Wei Ying could do that. He could do that with Lan Zhan. He clears his throat. "Um, let me put my apron up."


 


Lan Zhan waits patiently as he ducks out of the apron and folds it on a stool, then wriggles out from behind the bar. "You don't have to," Wei Ying tells him, just in case. "I didn't really --"


 


"Were you joking, when you asked?" Lan Zhan interrupts.


 


Wei Ying looks at him. He looks handsome and serious and a little nervous. "No," he says. "No, I wasn't."


 


Lan Zhan offers his hand.


 


Wei Ying takes it and lets himself be led a little way away from the bar. The gold-draped tables are still scattered between them and the rest of the dance floor when Lan Zhan stops and steps closer. Wei Ying drifts in towards him. "Not dancing with everyone else?" he wonders.


 


"We're not everyone else," Lan Zhan tells him.


 


Wei Ying laughs incredulously, his heart a nervous bird in his chest. "Alright," he agrees.


 


Lan Zhan considers their clasped hands, then releases his hold on Wei Ying in favor of doing hoverhands over his waist. "May I --" he begins, and Wei Ying puts his own hands firmly over Lan Zhan's so that he's solidly held.


 


"Yes," Wei Ying says belatedly. Wow, Lan Zhan's hands are warm, even through his dress shirt. Wei Ying releases him and slings his hands up to loop his arms around Lan Zhan's neck, and it brings their faces close together. Wei Ying couldn't quite tell from behind the bar, but they're almost the same height; Lan Zhan is maybe an inch or two taller than him, and a little wider. He's so fucking pretty, and this close he smells like some sort of dizzyingly sexy expensive cologne. They sway into each other, find the beat of the music. Wei Ying likes that Lan Zhan knows how to fight. That he teaches kids how to fight, teaches friendly strangers at awful weddings. That he drinks plain ice water except when someone else's granny orders him to drink hot water instead.


 


Wei Ying tilts his head down to rest his temple against Lan Zhan's shoulder. Lan Zhan makes a sound like, "Mmh," and pulls him a little closer.


 


"You're cute," Wei Ying tells his throat. "I don't usually do this." Which isn't precisely true: he flirts all the time, and sometimes he even gets somewhere with it. But he's never really meant it. Something about Lan Zhan makes him want to mean it.


 


"I don't either," Lan Zhan says. Wei Ying takes the liberty of pulling himself closer, this time, until their chests are pressed together. He can feel Lan Zhan's heart pounding against him. Lan Zhan squeezes his waist, slides his hands in to lie flat over Wei Ying's spine. One of their friends wolf-whistles. "Is this okay?" Lan Zhan asks, his voice quiet over Wei Ying's ear.


 


Wei Ying laughs shakily. "Uh, yeah. I think you could do just about anything and it would be okay, frankly."


 


"Mmh," Lan Zhan says again, and brushes his mouth over Wei Ying's ear.


 


"Fuck," Wei Ying mutters. "Okay, um, maybe not that. Or anything else that's gonna make me have to hide my boner when we go back. But, like, anything else."


 


"Noted," Lan Zhan says, sounding a little strangled.


 


"Sorry," Wei Ying says. "I'm too into you to know how to be subtle right now."


 


"No apologies necessary," Lan Zhan tells him graciously. "You don't need to be subtle. It's... a reasonable concern."


 


Wei Ying breathes in and lets himself think about that response for approximately half a second before shutting that train of thought right the fuck back down. "Great," he creaks. "So... Wen Qing said you're in library science?" he asks, instead of,

What are you doing immediately after this and do you want to come home with me instead?



 


"Mn," Lan Zhan says, changing tack gracefully. "My goal is to be an archivist. So much of our history is so easily lost; I'd like to help recover it."


 


"Which 'our' is that?" Wei Ying asks.


 


"Anyone," Lan Zhan says. "Everyone. I have specific interests. But all paper burns."


 


"... Wow," Wei Ying says. "I mean, yeah. That's intense. That's really cool, though."


 


"I think so," Lan Zhan agrees, then prompts, "You said you take notes."


 


"Oh, yeah. I'm not in school for anything, I just do citizen science. Like, bartender by night, guy who goes out to the sticks and counts bugs by day, sort of thing," Wei Ying says. "Sometimes I see a coyote or something and that's cool. It just feels good to be doing something that might actually matter. You'd think it wouldn't -- like, it's just bugs, right -- but any data is good data. Which kinds, how many, that sort of thing. You know we think Western science has only identified a little over half the bugs in the US?"


 


"I did not," Lan Zhan admits.


 


"Well. Western science has only identified a little over half the bugs in the US, probably," Wei Ying informs him very seriously. Lan Zhan's mouth ticks up at one corner.


 


"Have you ever identified a new species?" he asks.


 


Wei Ying blows air out through his lips. "Oh, like, maybe? Probably not? It's hard to tell -- and speciation is, like, looking increasingly fake anyway --" He glances up at Lan Zhan, who looks a little lost. "That's not the sexy answer, is it," Wei Ying guesses. "I revise: I haven't, but when I do I'll name my new bug species after you."


 


"Consider me seduced," Lan Zhan tells him, and Wei Ying wails and thunks his forehead back into Lan Zhan's shoulder.


 


After a moment he says, "Me too. You can consider me seduced too."


 


"Hm," Lan Zhan says. "That's good."


 


"Yeah," Wei Ying breathes, and then, "I think we need to stop talking about seduction or else," and so for the rest of the piece they stand there quietly leaning into each other, swaying together to the music. When the song ends they pull reluctantly apart, and Wei Ying wants to kiss him, but they're in public and at least in theory Lan Zhan is being discreet here and Wei Ying doesn't want to make it weird. Weirder. He clears his throat and steps away. Boner status: manageable. He says, "I should get back to work."


 


"Mn," Lan Zhan agrees, and they return to the bar, where Wen Qing is writing on one of four napkins in front of her.


 


"We're all exchanging numbers," she informs them as Wei Ying slithers behind the bar and ducks back into his apron. "If you dorks lose track of each other after tonight I will kill you with my hands. Also, Mianmian and I are friends now."


 


"Oh good," Wei Ying says. Wen Qing hands him a napkin that says LAN ZHAN and then a phone number. Lan Zhan gets a napkin that says WEI YING and LUO MIAN. "There's still hope for our ecosystem," Wei Ying mumbles, folding his napkin up and putting it in his pocket. Then he reaches over and draws some hearts around his own name and number on Lan Zhan's napkin for good measure, singing absently, "All my friends should be friends with my friends." Then he folds it up and leans over to tuck it into Lan Zhan's breast pocket.


 


When he looks up, Lan Zhan is staring at him. Wei Ying pats his chest once and leans away.


 


After a moment Wen Qing clears her throat. "So, we should go," she says. "We both have work early tomorrow."


 


"Ah? You're leaving before the lights turn off? What a betrayal!" Wei Ying cries. "Mianmian and I have to be here till ten."


 


"Sorry, kid," Wen Qing says. "At least you get to sleep in tomorrow." Wei Ying makes a face like

Yeah okay.



 


"It was good to meet you," Lan Zhan says to Luo Mian and Wei Ying.


 


"You too," Luo Mian says. "Both of you. We'll start a groupchat."


 


"Yeah," Wei Ying says quickly, "Yeah, we'll text. Like not right now because we're on the job, technically. But later."


 


Lan Zhan nods firmly. "Later," he agrees.


 


And then they say their goodbyes, and then Wen Qing and Lan Zhan retrieve their things from the table where they were sitting, and then they leave. And Luo Mian and Wei Ying just sort of sit there listening to the quartet for a full thirty seconds of loneliness.


 


And then Luo Mian says, "What the fuck are you waiting for? Go!" and Wei Ying says "Yep!" and leaps over the bar and dashes out through the lobby into the dark parking lot, where Lan Zhan has just shut the trunk of his car. Wei Ying shouts, "Hey!" and Wen Qing and Lan Zhan both turn, their faces turned orange with black smudges by the outdoor lighting.


 


"Wei Ying," Lan Zhan says, concerned. "Are you alright? Did we forget --"


 


Wei Ying catches him by the lapels of his jacket. "Yeah," he gasps, "Yeah, you forgot something, oh my god. Can I kiss you?"


 


Lan Zhan stares at him. Then he reaches up to cup Wei Ying's face in his hands, and tilts his head a little, and pulls him into a kiss. His mouth is soft and firm and warm, and that faint smell of fine cologne is back.


 


"Holy shit," Wei Ying mumbles into his mouth. Lan Zhan pulls him closer, lets himself be pressed back against the car. Wei Ying kisses him again, once, twice, manages, "You guys have to go.

I

have to go. Text me when you get home --"


 


"I will," Lan Zhan tells him, and kisses him again. Wei Ying whimpers, opens his mouth for Lan Zhan's tongue, sucks on it a little before they both draw back.


 


Wei Ying drops his head to Lan Zhan's shoulder again. Lan Zhan releases his face in favor of holding the back of his head, the nape of his neck. Wei Ying presses into him and says pathetically, "Sorry Wen Qing."


 


"It's fine," she says, her voice amused. "Kinda saw this coming."


 


"Oh," Wei Ying says. "I love that. Love that for us."


 


"You should go," Lan Zhan tells him quietly. "I'll text."


 


"Yeah," Wei Ying says, swallowing. He darts in for one last kiss, then pushes himself away. "Yeah. Goodnight, Lan Zhan. Wen Qing."


 


"Night," Wen Qing says.


 


"Goodnight, Wei Ying."


 


They climb into the car and pull out. Wei Ying watches the taillights until they're out of view.







*







The next wedding Wei Ying attends -- well, the next one is another bartending gig. But the one after that is his sister's, and Lan Zhan is his plus-one that time. After that is Luo Mian and her boyfriend, and then Lan Zhan's brother's friend, and then all at once Wen Qing has a

wife,

and then --


 


"My husband," Lan Zhan says for the very first time, three years later, and Wei Ying just can't help but to kiss him.
12158133 The Solubility of Stardust ['RayShippouUchiha'] Mature F/M Marvel Cinematic Universe, The Avengers (Marvel Movies), The Avengers (Marvel) - All Media Types, Iron Man (Movies), Iron Man - All Media Types, Captain America (Movies), Captain America - All Media Types, Guardians of the Galaxy (Movies), Guardians of the Galaxy (Comics), Guardians of the Galaxy - All Media Types Peter Quill/Tony Stark, Tony Stark & Guardians of the Galaxy Team, James "Rhodey" Rhodes & Tony Stark, Jarvis (Iron Man movies) & Tony Stark, Tony Stark & Stark Robots, Tony Stark & Vision Tony Stark, Vision (Marvel), Jarvis (Iron Man movies), James "Bucky" Barnes, James "Rhodey" Rhodes, Steve Rogers, Stark Robots (Marvel), Peter Quill, Yondu Udonta, Rocket Raccoon, Gamora (Marvel), Drax the Destroyer, Groot (Marvel), Mantis (Marvel), Clint Barton, Guardians of the Galaxy Team, Pepper Potts, Happy Hogan, Avengers Team, Wanda Maximoff, Natasha Romanova, Scott Lang, Sam Wilson (Marvel), Bruce Banner, Hulk (Marvel) Female Tony Stark, Alternate Universe - Gender Changes, Alternate Universe - Canon Divergence, Post-Captain America: Civil War (Movie), Canon Divergence - Captain America: Civil War (Movie), Not Canon Compliant, Not Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 2 Compliant, Angst, hurt comfort, Extremis, Betrayal, space, Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder - PTSD, Tony Feels, Tony-centric, Tony Stark Has a Heart, Tony Stark Needs a Hug, Tony Angst, Snark, Banter, Pop Culture, references, Team as Family, Yondu Lives, Kidnapping, Kidnapped Tony Stark, Bride-napping, Not A Fix-It, Not Wanda Friendly, Overprotective Jarvis, Protective Rhodey, Protective Vision, Peter is smitten, Tony is unimpressed, Alternate Universe of an Alternate Universe, Handwaving some issues aside, Just Roll With It, Comic Book Science, Not Thor: Ragnarok (2017) Compliant, Timeline What Timeline English 2017-09-22 Updated 2020-03-09 45,253 8/? 1,687 10,012 2,905 151,109 ['MareDeus', 'sara_chidouin', 'lilac_lily_rose_temptress_17', 'UnstableAstronaut', 'A_Person982', 'Estre11a', 'BrownXdoeXeyes', 'Vic007008', 'dontaskmeaboutthesethings', 'MrJoy_3OPking', 'LoveRoundWorld', 'Jurgenvren', 'JuliaMede', 'SmallPoisonBear', 'lindaej', 'milkboi9329', 'flaumjaze', 'Xielle_Sky', 'SOHIEN', 'Scuro', 'Lithium654', 'Copper_Waterfall', '1Diana_Rain', 'Vimmuu', 'MissSarcasticMess', 'Kris_Guerra17', 'Lanaofthenight', 'Sevvyn', 'XxMuXx', 'Catus_11', 'SakeDeArroz', 'TwistAndKnots', 'CrackedRunner', 'myownknight', 'Princesshannon2002', 'Obanaii', '1228EternalBalance', 'ThePeoplesVictory', 'Articdogzz', 'Turtle_One', 'Cay223', 'Capluofei', 'whatdoheroeswant', 'ssunshinee', 'klpxd', 'bugscanbeangery', 'CherryT0mat0es', 'Rat_Chimera', 'Sparkly_Chaotic_Neutral_Aesthetic', 'Sy_09'] [] Toni's cold.

It's the kind of cold she hasn't felt since those late nights in the cave with Yinsen.

Since she stepped through a wormhole and massacred untold thousands.

"Miss," JARVIS's voice is barely a whisper in her ear, more like a quiet sigh in the quickly approaching darkness.

"J?" She rasps out, blood thick and foul on her tongue.

"Yes, Miss," JARVIS answers as he always does, "you must stay awake."

"I'm tired," it comes out as a half sob, pain racking through her chest as she takes in a stuttering breath. "I'm tired JARVIS. I'm so tired."

It's true too.

Toni is tired, tired in a way she hasn't been since Jarvis died. She feels empty and carved out, hollow inside like she hasn't since she laid him in the ground.

She's exhausted down to her bones.

"I know you are Miss," JARVIS soothes her, voice as gentle as a lullabye. "But you must stay awake."

He doesn't fool her though, not her baby boy.

Even as exhausted and beaten down as she is Toni can hear the carefully concealed desperation in his tone.

He's frightened.

Like he had been during the creeping death of the palladium.

During the terror of New York.

During the horror that was Ultron.

She's scared her boy, and she's so very sorry for doing this to him yet again. It seems as if that's all she ever does. Hurt the ones she loves, one way or another.

Maybe it'd be best if she just ...

Toni feels herself begin to drift, feels the way the darkness creeps just a bit closer.

"Mother! " JARVIS' sharp reprimand snaps her back to awareness. "You must not sleep."

"I'm sorry," Toni whispers as she forces her eyes open again, blinks past the drip of blood from her scalp that's already begun to dry and the curls that've fallen into her face. "J, baby, I'm sorry."

She coughs, ragged and painfully deep, and her gauntlet comes away from her battered face splattered with blood.

"Shh, Miss," JARVIS soothes her again. "This was all ... you have nothing to apologize for. You must only stay awake."

She grimaces, raises a hand to press uselessly against the pitted front of the armor.

The armor's shot, the integrity of its casing a thing of the past. She can't fly out of here. She can barely move. She's alone except for JARVIS in her ear and she's losing heat fast.

She's losing fast.

Toni breathes as deeply as she can bare at the moment and lets it out in a long, slow, whistling hiss. Beneath the armor her chest is a mess. She can feel the steady trickle of blood running down her sides, can feel where pieces of the suit have bent inwards. Can feel where her ribs don't sit right anymore.

She'd always known love would wreck her someday. Had always known that it would be the end of her in one way or another.

But she'd never thought it would be like this.

She'd never thought it would be Steve, with Bucky miraculously returned to his side, who would deal the killing blow.

"Not sure it's gonna matter J." Toni tells him ruefully after a long silent moment has passed. She's slumped against one of the support struts, hidden from the worst of the blasting wind behind her, but the snow is already beginning to pile up a bit at the edges. "Not sure I got much choice. You feeling up to telling me Icarus again? I think ... I'd like to hear it ... just in case."

"You promised," JARVIS snaps at her, angry and defiant and as close to desperate as she's ever heard him. "You promised you would stay with me, that you would not go where I could not follow you. Not if you could help it. You can do this Miss, so now I shall hold you to your word. There will be no stories, no goodbyes. Not this time. You will stay awake. You will hold on until I reach you. You will live."

"I'm trying, J," Toni sighs, ragged and painful. "But we both know how this is gonna end. Just like last time, we know how this plays out. Don't think we'll pull another miracle out of the hat for this one, baby boy."

"I launched a suit in your direction as soon as you departed your helicopter in pursuit of Captain Rogers and Sergeant Barnes, Miss." JARVIS tells her. "I no longer trusted the Captain to have your safety as a primary concern. I thought one of the repurposed Legionnaires would be a welcomed and hopefully unnecessary addition to your party. Vision has also been alerted and is in route. You must simply hold on until they arrive."

Toni swallows down a painful laugh because of course he did. Her boy , so smart, so resourceful, so over protective. But it still might not be enough.

Her chest aches, pain that she's only really felt a handful of times before arcing through her. A slow, creeping death.

"I'll try," Toni tells him again. It's the best she can offer because this ... this is one thing she can't build her way out of.

Not now.

Not this time.

She's already too far gone for that.

"It won't be long now," JARVIS reassures her softly. "Less than ten minutes. Then we will bring you home. Where you belong. Where you will be safe. As you should be."

 Home.

The Compound.

Even the thought of it aches.

It isn't her home.

Not really.

Not anymore.

Not since ... well not for a few years now.

"I wanted us to be a family, all of us. I wanted us to protect the world together." Toni rasps as tears pool in the corners of her eyes. She doesn't bother to blink them away like she normally does. There's no one here to see them, there's only JARVIS in her ear. He'll keep her secrets as he always does. "I just wanted to keep everyone safe."

"I know you did Miss," JARVIS replies. "I know. You did the best you could with what you had. Please ... you must know that."

"It was all just a dream ," Toni tells him with a desperate, aching kind of sadness. "It was a dream and I was stupid enough to think I could be part of it. I ruin everything I touch."

"No." JARVIS' voice is hard, almost angry, and there's something like grief hiding there, just beneath the rage. "You are a light in the darkness Miss. You must never forget that. We love you, your family loves you. We will never leave you. So you must hold on, for us."

Toni slumps down even further. JARVIS' love, as always, warms her deep inside. Just like Rhodey's always has.

"I'll wait right here for you," Toni finally agrees even as her eyes slip shut, tears and blood mixing with the slowly forming ice on her face. "Ain't got anywhere else to be J."

The darkness rises back up again then, clawed fingers extended in her direction.

Toni tries to fight it, for JARVIS, for Rhodey and the bots, for Pepper and Happy.

But she's already so tired.

The darkness grabs her, pulls her down.

And in her chest the reactor flickers and fades out like a dying star.

~~~

"I am so sorry," a familiar voice whispers in her ear but Toni doesn't have the strength to open her eyes. "Forgive me, Toni."

There's the sound of tearing metal and then she's being lifted, the armor falling away around her like water sluicing off of her skin.

It hurts , sends sharp knives of pain through her chest and her ribs.

The ground is hard and cold beneath her back in the next second, the thick arms that had held her now gone.

"I must do this," the voice, accented and so familiar it hurts, tells her softly. "It is the only way."

There are hands on her chest, ripping her blouse open and reaching for the reactor.

There's a click, a twist , and Toni feels it being lifted from her chest far too easily.

There's only two ways to take the reactor out and only two people besides Toni should know either of them.

JARVIS and Rhodey.

The voice belongs to neither of them so Toni tries to fight.

Tries to marshal her quickly fading strength and stop whoever this is from taking her heart away from her again.

She manages to pry her eyes open and above her Vision's face hovers, creased uncharacteristically in worry.

In his hands a fresh reactor shines.

The relief she feels when he slots it into place is indescribable.

" V-Vis-ion," her lips feel chapped and talking is almost beyond her. She hasn't felt this weak, this small, since she was a child.

Back when she used to cower beneath Howard's fists and feet.

"Hush," Vision tells her, sorrow heavy in his tone as he kneels beside her. "I am here, you are safe now."

Toni shakes her head as best she can, something is wrong, she can tell. Sorrow is too heavy in Vision's expression, too thick in his voice.

The ground beneath her is warmer than it was before.

"This should have never happened." Vision says, and it sounds like a declaration of mourning. "This is a price that should not have been paid."

"R-Rhodey?" She manages to choke the question out.

Rhodey had fallen and she'd been too late.

If it hadn't been for the Spiderling, T'Challa, and Vision working together he would have hit the ground.

As it was he'd still been hurt.

He'd been hurt and she'd left him there in that hospital to go after Steve.

"Colonel Rhodes is fine," Vision reassures her as he smooths a hand across her forehead. His touch is gentle, soft, as he sweeps her curls from her face and carefully wipes away a bit of the blood. "He's unconscious still, there's been some swelling in his spine but the doctors predict a full recovery. He'll be glad to see you when you return I'm sure."

Toni tries to smile, knows her teeth are probably stained red with blood.

She's not going home, no matter what she'd promised JARVIS.

They both know that.

The cold that had been creeping up on her hadn't been just from the snow and the ice.

Vision shifts then, hands moving out of her sight, but there's a determined set to his face and shoulders that wasn't there before.

"JARVIS informed me that he had your permission," he says solemnly moments later. "And I regret that he is correct and that this is the only way. But I need you to tell me yes yourself. I will not take this choice from you. Too many choices have already been disregarded."

In his hand is a large gauge syringe.

It glows golden in the low light.

"You must come back to us, Miss," JARVIS whispers in her ear, voice resolute but still faintly pleading. "All that matters is that you return."

Toni coughs, tastes the ever swelling blood in her mouth rise up a bit higher and thicker, and then nods as best she can.

Toni is a scrap heap, is so much scattered glass. There's nothing left in her. All she can do is take the chance she's being presented with and hope it'll be enough.

Vision smiles, soft and sad, grief heavy in his face.

He presses the needle against her chest, right beside the reactor and directly over her heart.

With a swift, sharp jerk he shoves it in deep.

Toni gasps, arches up into the shock of it, and then falls back down.

There's a breathless, silent second, and then there is nothing but pain.

Toni screams as Extremis rushes through her like a fire and burns her away inside.

Turns her to nothing more than ash and stardust.

She'll either die in the process or she'll be made anew.

 Reforged.

~~~


 2 years later


~~~

Toni grits her teeth and deliberately keeps her hands loose and open at her sides. She can't let the anger take her. Can't let herself loose even a bit of her tightly held control. Not anymore. Not with them.

She won't give any of them the satisfaction and, frankly, she's even more dangerous now that she used to be.

Which is saying something, all things considered.

"I could kill them," JARVIS tells her simply, tone even and bland like he's not talking about murder. He's grown even more vicious in the two years since the so called Civil War.

"Unfortunately that's not an option J," Toni mutters lowly as she strides through the door and out into the night. The massive yard around the Compound is dark and quiet. "Too much paperwork involved."

As always, JARVIS had been right by her side through all of it. Through Rhodey's brief stint in physical therapy, through amending the Accords, through rebuilding the team, through the pain and the nightmares.

Through the nights where Toni couldn't sleep and the days where she'd longed for rest of a more permanent kind.

JARVIS and Rhodey, Vision and the bots. Pepper and Happy and even the Spiderling had all been lifelines for her. Anchoring points to keep her steady as she navigated her way through the destruction the others had left in their wake.

And now ... now it had all come to fruition.

The Accords were now much more palatable than they'd once been, Thunder-dick Ross was rotting in a jail cell, and the rogues had been brought back into the fold.

Toni should have felt satisfied, should have felt accomplished.

And, in a way, she did.

But at the same time it felt just like it had back at the beginning. Back during New York and in the first year or so afterwards when they'd all butted heads. When she'd been a puzzle piece that didn't fit correctly, a loose screw that refused to tighten.

Only now there was none of the hope she'd held onto even then, none of the desire to build a team and a family with the others. None of the warmth that had eventually grown between them only to be snuffed out bit by bit each time none of them believed her about what she saw through that wormhole.

After Ultron.

After Wanda had ...

After the others hadn't ...


 Well.


Now there is only the lingering ache of betrayal.

And the memory of bleeding out in Vision's arms on the concrete floor of an abandoned HYDRA base.

"I would kill them for this, for the pain they have cause you and our family, if you ask it of me." JARVIS presses stubbornly. "I could do it even if you didn't. If you would prefer to not be ... involved."

"Your new and aggressive bent towards supervillainy is both terrifying and adorable. I feel like it should worry me but, honestly, I'm kind of proud." Toni bites back the smile that tries to creep its way across her mouth. "Follow your dreams J," Toni pauses, considers for a moment, "unless it's murder. As a superhero I'm generally required to discourage murder. No matter how irritating you might find someone."

"Their ungracious attitudes try not only my patience but that of Colonel Rhodes and Vision as well." JARVIS snipes back tartly. "If I am to be named a supervillain rest assured I would not be alone in my newfound profession."

"True," Toni grins outright, unable to help herself. "If all else I'm pretty sure Butterfingers would follow you. Out of solidarity if for no other reason. Though I'm pretty sure evil mastermind has been his dream job for years now."

"For once I find Butterfinger's propensity for violence to be rather refreshing." JARVIS says. "In fact I find it to be rather worthy of encouragement."

"If he keeps on with that blowtorch either he's going to burn the Compound down or DUM-E's going to have an actual stroke." Toni tells him flatly but still amused.

It's true too. DUM-E constantly has his fire-extinguisher on hand now-days because Butterfingers has been brandishing a blowtorch at anyone who came down to the workshop who wasn't Rhodey, Vision, or the Spider-baby for the past six months. He is, surprisingly, tolerant of Bu- Barnes after JARVIS had apparently had a word with him on Toni's behalf but everyone else is fair game.

Fair game since JARVIS doesn't seem inclined to protect them any more than Toni herself does these days.

Rhodey seems to find the entire thing hysterical and she's pretty sure he's the one who keeps replacing the butane tanks every time they run out. It seems like the sort of petty thing he'd do, glorious asshole of a man that he is.

Granted it could have been Vision considering the fact that he's somehow become just as petty as the rest of her small family over the past two years. JARVIS and Rhodey have been a horrible/wonderful influence on him apparently.

U has, as always, been the calmest of the lot but he doesn't have Toni fooled for a second. She knows he's the one who keeps tying trip wires at about neck height for both Barton and Rogers. Rhodey's learned to duck as he comes into the workshop now and Vision just phases through the nearest wall.

She's also sure the Spider-tot is the one who keeps giving him the wire to do it with too.

All of that aside someone keeps giving Butterfinger's murderous ass fresh fuel for the damn blowtorch. Toni's already had to replace the couch twice and one of the tall ferns in Mother's terrarium.

She's not going to take it away from him of course but that's hardly the point.

"Let's take a break for a bit baby boy." Toni pipes up after a moment of silence. "I'm feeling like a bit of a change of scenery. How about me and you go for a fly?"

"I am, as always, here with you Miss." JARVIS agrees. He likes it when she leaves the Compound these days, has even been not so subtly hinting at them either moving back to the Tower permanently or perhaps even back to Malibu.

Toni smiles, warm at heart with the love she has for him, and calls the armor up from within her.

It folds around her smoothly, slides across her skin like silk.

Extremis had, luckily for her, been so very kind to her in more than one respect.

"Let's go J," Toni takes a step forward and kicks off of the ground in a deliberately showy move of still new strength.

"Wherever you wish to go I will always follow." JARVIS reminds her, a promise he'd given her after New York when the terror of being separated by the worm hole had been fresh for him.

"I wouldn't have it any other way." And she wouldn't either.

He's her son and she loves him so.

~~~

Toni flies aimlessly for awhile, mind drifting in the peace and quiet she only finds in the armor these days. The safety that only JARVIS in her ear or Rhodey at her side or Vision at her back has been able to give her for what seems like forever now.

She finally settles down on a cliff side somewhere on the coast, far out from any kind of town or city. There are no lights and the stars are so bright they take her breath away for a long moment as she lets the armor slip back beneath her skin.

It's one part awe and two parts terror to be honest.

Terror because she knows what's out there and no one outside of a select few seem to want to believe her.

So, fuck it. She'll just have to do whatever she can, whatever she has to do, to keep the world safe with what help she has.

It's one of the reasons she'd supported efforts to push the other's pardons through.

Because they might have abandoned her but Toni won't, can't, abandon the world.

No matter what it costs her.

~~~

"Miss," she's standing on the cliff side still, head tilted back to the stars and mind whirling, when JARVIS pipes up in her ear an hour or so later. "One of our satellites picked up an unusual reading a few moments ago. A large, unidentified craft has entered Earth's airspace but seemed to disappear only moments later. What information I gathered says that it does not match any of the scans we took of the Chitauri, or even Prince Thor, but it has entered our atmosphere nonetheless."

Toni goes tense and the armor comes to her half thought call with barely any hesitation.

"Where?" She barks the question out. "Give me a possible trajectory J. Did it emit any kind of traceable signal? Fuck it, I'll check myself. You call Rhodey, get him and the others mobilized. We're not going to be caught off guard here."

"Yes Miss."

Toni turns her attention inwards and unleashes the tightly held control she normally keeps on Extremis, lets it branch out and speed across her connection to J and out towards the data JARVIS had told her about.

It takes her only a few seconds to pinpoint what he was talking about.

There.

A mid-sized craft, large by Earth standards of course, but also traveling alone. It had flickered across the sensors of the latest upgraded satellite Toni had funded and put into orbit for just this reason for a split second and then it was gone.

Only a slight heat and radiation trail was left in its wake. It would have been untraceable for anyone else who looked for it.

Luckily Toni's always been a cut above the rest.

"Colonel Rhodes' is aware and he and Vision are mobilizing the others Miss." JARVIS chimes in down her line. "Full assembly in less than three minutes. Arrival to your destination in under ten."

Toni's attention sharpens as she traces the trajectory and she feels her mind go smooth as she settles into battle mode.

"Not gonna have ten minutes J," she finally murmurs as she comes back to herself.

"Miss?" JARVIS sounds almost worried.

"Got a feeling whoever this is has got a specific goal in mind," Toni says, deliberately overloud even as her spine stiffens.

Above her a spotlight abruptly turns on and the clearing is flooded with light.

"Well," a gruff voice calls out from far too close, "you ain't wrong about that."

Toni forces herself to remain calm as she prepares herself to face this new player in the game. Whoever they were they'd made a beeline straight for her location once they'd entered Earth's atmosphere so obviously she's a part of whatever it is they're doing. And they'd gotten so close to her without either her or JARVIS picking up on them until she'd manually traced the ship's trajectory.

Their ship's cloaking device had been able to fool her sensors. They'd beaten her tech.

 Her tech.

Beaten it.

With apparently superior stealth tech.

It was something that had never happened to Toni before and it made her want to curse, low and mean, and possibly scream.

"Make a note J," Toni mutters as she turns, "we've got some upgrading to do."

"Please do focus on the possible alien menace Miss," JARVIS snips back. "Vision has left ahead and is less than six minutes out. Colonel Rhodes is with him and the others will be following in the quinjet."

She takes in his words, slots them away, and focuses on the here and now. Beneath the faceplate Toni feels her brows arch high in surprise.

The alien is, by Earth standards at least, seemingly male.

He's also fucking blue.

"Hey there Papa Smurf," Toni calls out with deliberate ease in her tone. "Fancy meeting you here. You got business with me specifically or did you stop by to see how the smurfberries were coming along?"

To her surprise the alien, guy?, smurf?, she honestly doesn't know and probably shouldn't care at this point, throws his head back and laughs, the strange red fin on his scalp glinting in the bright lights of the ship that hovers above them.

"You're perfect," he crows loudly, hands braced on his hips. "Better than I'd hoped you'd be. Kraglin's gonna owe me units after this."

"Thanks," Toni drawls, "I certainly think so but popular opinion might not flow so smooth with that outlook." Toni waits a beat. "You got a name Blue Wonder?"

"Yondu," blue guy tells her, chest puffed out just a bit, "Yondu Udonta. Ravager."

"Toni Stark," Toni dips her head in a small nod, every sense alert and armor primed and ready because on one hand she doesn't know or trust this alien and on the other she's not looking to start an intergalactic incident by attacking first like some people would. "Iron Queen."

Unless she has to of course.

Then all bets are off.

"Oh I know who you are," Yondu unexpectedly nods as he tucks his hands against his belt, long red leather coat pushed back off of his hips. "Done heard all about you. Wouldn't be here if I hadn't."

"That's ... kind of unsettling to be honest." Toni blinks in slight surprise. "Also kind of surprising. And I'm used to being famous so that's saying a lot."

"Got a whole galaxy of folk up there chatting bout you," Yondu nods. "Figured that make you perfect for what I got in mind."

Toni feels unease slither down her spine at the intent look on Yondu's face.

"And what," she asks slowly as she primes the repulsors and readies herself to move, "would that be exactly?"

"Never thought I'd come after another mouthy Terran," Yondu grins, crooked teeth unabashedly bared and seemingly unconcerned, "but my boy ... well he deserves the best. Figured I'd make up for threatenin' to eat him all those years. Might stop him from being so pissy all the time."

"That's real sweet and all," Toni cuts in sharply as understanding dawns on her, "but I doubt he's my type. And it's not the blue thing either, because that could be hot. It's more along the lines of the whole I'm not leaving with you thing."

"Well see, that's where you're wrong," Yondu smirks and abruptly whistles. Toni's startled for a split second by the arrow that darts towards her from where it had been sheathed at his waist. The fin on his head glows a threatening red.

Toni twirls, blasts at it with the repulsor and grits her teeth when she misses. The thing's too fucking fast even if he is controlling it by goddamn whistling apparently.

She arms a set of the shoulder rockets, turns to take aim at Yondu himself, and bites back a scream as agony lights up her senses.

"Miss!" JARVIS' voice is staticy but still in her ear as she clenches her teeth against the pain.

The armor, unbelievably, slumps around her and Toni's vision wavers as she slumps to the ground. The suit melts back into her bones as it always does when it's too damaged to function and needs to be repaired.

Toni's left vulnerable, splayed out on the ground and paralyzed.

This, none of this, should be possible. The armor is insulated. She'd made sure of it after Vanko and again after one too many training sessions with a thunder happy Thor. Electricity shouldn't touch her like this.

"Shit, Kraglin, you didn't kill her did ya?" Yondu demands as he moves forward to hover over her. To her surprise there's concern in his expression.

"Nah Captain," another, unfamiliar voice, apparently Kraglin, chimes in. "Just shocked her a bit, should be safe enough. Least ways that's what Rocket said."

There's a second, surprisingly human looking face hovering over her then. Kraglin's scruffy looking, lean and rangy, and he's wearing a red leather coat just like Yondu.

In one of his hands is some kind of gun Toni doesn't recognize and in the other is a thick black band that looks an awful lot like a collar of some kind. Dred pools deep and heavy in her stomach.

Toni's body is frozen as Kraglin leans down and clicks the collar around her throat. Immediately she feels trapped, feels like she's been cut off from something greater. She tries to call for the armor, damaged as it is, but the signal buts up against some kind of wall and refuses to move outwards. Same thing when she reaches out desperately towards where the quinjet should be rapidly approaching.

"Hold on Miss," JARVIS is openly desperate but still in her ear even with the slight static on her ear piece. Apparently the collar works only on her and has left the separate channel her earpiece functions on alone. "The others are almost there. Wait for them."

Toni already knows they're not going to make it in time. There's too much distance and Yondu's ship is too advanced. She'll have to fix that when she gets out of this mess.

"Don't know what she can do but that suppression collar should keep her calm for a bit. Plus we've got incoming Captain," Kraglin speaks up suddenly, attention focused on some kind of tech attached to his arm. "Looks like she's got friends."

"Ah hell Kraglin we knew that when we came," Yondu sucks on his teeth. "Don't matter none, so let's get going. Supposed to be meeting up with the others soon anyways. Ain't really in no mood to fight no Terrans right now."

"You think he's gonna like her?" Kraglin asks as Yondu bends down and scoops Toni into his arms with surprising gentleness.

"She's a pretty little thing," Yondu winks down at her as he moves towards the hovering ship and the rapidly descending freight carrier. "A queen too from what she said. Makes sense I guess. Figured she'd be a good match for 'em either way. Him being Star Lord and all."

"Ain't you worried bout her people coming for her?" Kraglin doesn't sound that concerned despite the question.

"Hell no," Yondu scoffs. "Terran's ain't out in space with the rest of the galaxy yet. Plus, way I hear tell this one right here's the only one we'd really have to worry about anyways."

"Still not sure if he's gonna like this Captain," Kraglin sounds uncertain then, "us stealin her like this. Don't even wanna think bout what some of the others are gonna say."

"They'll come around," Yondu sounds certain. "Plus ain't like we hurt her none, not really. She ain't no kid and we ain't taking her to slave. Ain't broke no rules, Ravager or Guardian. Just ... thinking outside the box a bit. He's done sulked enough. A wife might cheer him up a bit."

"If you say so Captain," Kraglin finally relents.

Toni is dazed but still understands what's going on around her even if she can't do anything about it at the moment.

But that won't last forever.

They'll make a mistake, Yondu and Kraglin or this bastard Star Lord they're taking her to.

And once they do they'll figure out why, exactly, it's a terrible idea to kidnap Toni Stark.

You guys are so sweet to me. So here's the next part and I hope you like it!!

"Miss," JARVIS' voice is faint, still almost a whisper thanks to that electrical charge that Kraglin had shot her up with.

"Hmm," Toni hums lowly, all too aware that she's still in Yondu's arms even though they've made it inside the ship and Kraglin's settled in what looks like a pilot's chair.

She feels it when they take off, feels the change in pressure and the way the air in the ship seems to shift.

She grits her teeth against the need to scream because they're taking her.


 They're taking her away from her family.


Yondu turns and carries her away from the cockpit, presumably to take her wherever it is he plans to stash her for the time being.

Toni tracks her eyes across everything she can see as he moves. A part of her mind is already whirling over what she can see of the consoles, over the possible composition of the metals and materials that make up the ship. Over the possible power source and energy outputs.

Speed, maneuverability, durability.

A million and one things that, under different circumstances, would fascinate her. Things she would have given a lot to have the opportunity to study.

Now she's just trying to decide which part of what she wants to rig to explode.

"You get some rest Missy," Yondu says with a quirk of a smile as he lays her down on a surprisingly comfortable cot inside of a surprisingly cluttered room. "Should take a bit for that stun you took to wear off. Gonna be sore as all hell when you wake up I expect."

Toni manages to bear her teeth in a smile that's more snarl than anything else.

"Cute," Yondu quips with another grin as he moves away from her and back towards the door. "You gonna fit right in."

He flashes her a jovial wave, slaps a hand against the console by the door, and walks out whistling, door shutting firmly behind him with a muffled clink.

 Asshole.

"Update me J," Toni gathers the strength to mutter lowly.

"The quinjet is not fast enough." JARVIS pipes up at once. "Neither is Vision nor Colonel Rhodes. You have already breached Earth's atmosphere and only Vision is fit for space travel," JARVIS sounds both desperate and angry. "By my calculations you'll be out of range of our satellites soon. There's no way to tell if Extremis will be able to compensate enough to keep us from being disconnected across the vastness of space, especially with that collar on."

Toni breathes out a hiss of frustration.

Fucking smurf bastard.

Fucking kidnapping asshole.

Fucking space.

"Got any bright ideas baby boy?" Toni asks.

"Just the one Miss," JARVIS hesitates for a split second. "I could do an emergency upload. Extremis might not be able to reach outside your body ... but I believe I could reach out to you instead. But I suspect that it is going to hurt."

His understanding of pain has also grown over the years and Toni is torn between being proud of his growth and hating the fact that it's been necessary.

Still, last time she'd heard this kind of hesitation had been when Vision had loaded her full of Extremis on the floor of that bunker.

"I can take it," Toni rasps decisively after a second.

She can.

She will.

Especially if it means there's a chance she can keep JARVIS in her ear.

"I know you can, Miss," JARVIS sounds sad. "Now, we must hurry, there isn't much time. Brace yourself, uploading in three, two, one."

It hurts.

There's no denying that.

It's like someone split her skull open and poured liquid fire into the cavity.

But Toni's lived through open heart surgery in a cave,
8572348 Lift Your Open Hand ['firethesound'] Mature M/M Harry Potter - J. K.
